Constructor Detail

GridNavigator

public GridNavigator(Tracker myTracker,
                     ObstacleDetector myDetector)
A constructor. It also initializes a 6x8 grid for the navigator to navigate the robot on, since that is the size of the grid we're using in class.

Parameters:
myTracker - the tracker the navigator uses
myDetector - the obstacle detector the navigator uses
Method Detail

moveTo

public void moveTo(int x,
                   int y)
Tells the robot to move to a specific location, given by x,y coordinates that correspond to the grid the robot is navigating on.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate, from 0 to gridWidth-1
y - the y-coordinate, from 0 to gridHeight-1

updateObstaclePosition

public void updateObstaclePosition(Node obstacleNode)
Updates the status of the node containing the obstacle.

Parameters:
obstacleNode - the obstacle node to block

updateRobotPosition

public void updateRobotPosition(Node destination)
Updates the destination that the grid navigator has stored.

Parameters:
destination - the node that we are now at

getXPos

public int getXPos()
Returns:
the x coordinate of the grid navigator's current position

getYPos

public int getYPos()
Returns:
the y coordinate of the grid navigator's current position

getHeading

public int getHeading()
Gives the heading of the robot. 0 - positive x-direction 1 - positive y-direction 2 - negative x-direction 3 - negative y-direction

Returns:
the heading of the robot right now, 0-3

objectFound

public boolean objectFound(PolarPoint objectLocation)
Blocks the node of the grid that corresponds to the node that the obstacle was detected at. We figure out the position of the obstacle by looking at the robot's current position, its heading, and the distance that the obstacle detector saw it at.

Specified by:
objectFound in interface ObstacleListener
Parameters:
objectLocation - the location of the object in polar coordinates
Returns:
true if a new obstacle is found that we didn't see before, false else
